Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Publisher.publisherName: Jewish National Fund. $b Youth and Education Department
Subject: Tu bi-Shevat
Name.creator: Eitan, Ora, $d 1940-
Description.note: Poster depicts a collage of a girl with a bowl on her head. The bowl contains fruit, flowers, leaves, and grains, with a dove perched on top. The girl has black hair, cheeks stylized like orange flowers, a red and white polka dot neckerchief, and a white shirt. Background is gingham.|~|Verso of poster reads: Tu B'shvat.|~|Signed "אורה איתן" in upper right.
Description.caption: Jewish National Fund, Youth and Education Dept. 42 East 69th st. New York 21, N.Y.
Title: חג השבועות, חג הבכורים = Shavuoth - the harvest festival

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Israel $x History $y 1948-1967 $v Maps|~|Arab-Israeli conflict $y 1948-1967 $v Maps
Name.creator: Manson, Josine
Description.note: Poster depicts a map of Israel, with international boundaries, armistice boundaries, Jewish cities, Jewish settlements, Arab cities, Arab villages, roads, railroads, rivers, and rivulets (wadis).|~|Relief shown by gradient tints.|~|Includes 2 inset maps: Jewish National Fund and other Jewish-owned lands in Israel; Industry & agriculture in Israel.|~|Includes index of cities and towns.|~|Scale 1:500,000.|~|Verso of poster reads "map of Israel" in blue ink.
Description.caption: Issued by the Jewish National Fund of America. New York N.Y.|~|C.S. Hammond & Co., N.Y.|~|Maps by Josine Manson
Title: Israel
